#id=1
#text=I began to repair my flat bicycle tire by removing the wheel from the bike .
#id=2
#text=This was done by disconnecting the brake cable so the wheel would be able to be removed from the frame .
#id=3
#text=I then loosened the bolts holding it on and slid the axle off the frame , making sure that the chain did not get caught or bind up while doing so .
#id=4
#text=After the wheel was removed , I made sure that all possible air was out of the tube so that it would be easier to remove .
#id=5
#text=I next took two flat head screwdrivers and began to remove the tire from the bicycle .
#id=6
#text=After the tire was finally removed , I pulled the tube off the rim as well .
#id=7
#text=Next , I placed a new tube in place making sure that the valve stem was placed through the rim appropriately .
#id=8
#text=After doing this , I began to fit the tire to the rim , making sure the tube was placed inside the tire and not pinched at all .
#id=9
#text=Once the tire was on the rim , I inflated the tube , making sure that the tire seated onto the rim properly and that everything held air .
#text=Finally , I reinstalled the wheel onto the bike , and reconnected everything appropriately .
